translation: Model for Blur Generation (Pmx)

id: ブレ生成対象モデルPmxファイルを選択してください
translation: Please select the Pmx file for the Blur Generation Model

id: ブレ生成対象モデルの使い方
translation:
- You can set the Pmx model where you want to apply the blur setting
- The string in the model name field can be selected
Verification Motion (Vmd/Vpd)

id: 確認用モーション(Vmd/Vpd)ファイルを選択してください
translation: Please select the Verification Motion (Vmd/Vpd) file

id: 確認用モーションの使い方
translation:
- You can set any motion Vmd or Vpd
- The string in the model name field in the motion can be selected
Output Model (Pmx)

id: 出力モデル(Pmx)ファイルパスを指定してください
translation: Please specify the file path for the Output Model (Pmx)

- You can set the output file path for the model with the blur setting.
- The output destination is set automatically, but it can be changed to any path
Proceed to Next
Clear Input
Save
Preview
Cancel Preview and Readjust

- Please specify the Pmx model you want to apply the blur setting
- Setting motion is optional
- Once the model display is confirmed, click the 'Proceed to Next' button at the bottom

The target model for blur setting was successfully loaded.
Proceed to the Step.2 tab

Failed to load the target model for blur setting.
Please check if the correct file path is specified

- Make sure that only the materials you want to apply the blur setting to are selected
- For Japanese swords, select only the materials related to the blade

The target materials for blur setting have been successfully set.
Proceed to the Step.3 tab

No target materials for blur setting are selected.
Please select one or more materials you want to apply the blur setting to

- For the material you want to apply the blur setting to, select a single vertex at the starting point of the ridge.
- For Japanese swords, this is the ridge area.
- If there are overlapping vertices, they will be displayed separated by commas
- If you mistakenly select a vertex, you can deselect it by pressing the Ctrl key and clicking the vertex again.

The starting vertex of the ridge for blur setting has been successfully set.
Proceed to the Step.4 tab

No starting vertex of the ridge for blur setting is selected.
Please select a single vertex at the starting point of the ridge for the material you want to apply the blur setting to.

- For the material you want to apply the blur setting to, select a single vertex at the tip.
- If there are overlapping vertices, they will be displayed separated by commas
- If you mistakenly select a vertex, you can deselect it by pressing the Ctrl key and clicking the vertex again.

The vertex at the tip for the blur setting has been successfully set.
Proceed to the Step.5 tab

No vertex at the tip for the blur setting is selected.
Please select a single vertex at the tip for the material you want to apply the blur setting to.

- For the material you want to apply the blur setting to, select the vertices on the blade side where you want to display the blur.
- The order of selection is arbitrary.
- If there are overlapping vertices, they will be displayed separated by commas
- If you mistakenly select a vertex, you can deselect it by pressing the Ctrl key and clicking the vertex again.

No vertices on the blade side for the blur setting are selected.
Please select the vertices on the blade side where you want to display the blur.
Generation Failed
Generation Successful

Failed to generate the model with the blur setting
Error Message: {{.Error}}

Successfully generated the model with the blur setting
The preview model is rotating on the original model

[Things to Check]
- Does the blur extend only on the ridge side? 
   The blur material is set to extend only on the ridge side to represent the momentum
   (The blur material extends in the opposite direction of the downward motion)
   Please confirm that the blur does not extend in a strange direction
   (To make the blur part easier to understand, a red morph has been added)
- Are there any missing vertices in the blur material? 
   The vertices on the ridge side are set to extend as blur, and the vertices on the blade side are made to follow the main body.
   If there are holes in the blur material, it means that there are not enough vertices selected in Step.5.

If you want to change the settings, click the 'Cancel Preview and Readjust' button, the second in Step.5.
If there were no issues, click the 'Save' button.
Output Failed
Output Successful

Failed to output the model with the blur setting
Error Message: {{.Error}}

Successfully output the model with the blur setting
By default, the blur material is hidden, so please add the display morph
The motion used for the preview is also output for reference

{{.Path}}
No Output Model

id: 出力モデルなしメッセージ
translation:
No model with the blur setting available for output.
Please redo the preview
Setting Failed
Tool Overview

This tool is for adding blur settings to weapons (mainly assumed to be swords).
The blur appears on the ridge side when the sword is swung down.
By default, it is hidden, and transparency is adjusted and displayed with morphs.
Additionally, color morphs and AL morphs are also created.
Step.1 Overview

Set the PMX model you want to add blur settings to in the 'Model for Blur Generation' field.
Setting the verification motion is optional.
Once the model is displayed correctly, click the 'Proceed to Next' button at the bottom of the screen.
Step.2 Overview

Make sure that only the materials for which you want to add blur settings are selected from all materials set in the 'Model for Blur Generation'.
Initially, all materials are selected, and unselected ones will be hidden.
Once only the materials for which you want to add blur settings are displayed, click the 'Proceed to Next' button at the bottom of the screen.
Step.3 Overview

From the material you want to add blur settings to, select the hand vertex on the ridge side (the hand vertex in the direction you want to extend the blur).
Blur will be generated on the vertices from the selected root vertex towards the tip.
When Step.3 is displayed, wireframe and vertex selection features are turned ON.
Overlapping vertices (vertices at the same location) will be displayed separated by commas.
Once the root vertex is selected, click the 'Proceed to Next' button at the bottom of the screen.
Step.4 Overview

Select the tip (end point of the blur) vertex from the materials you want to add blur settings to.
When Step.4 is displayed, wireframe and vertex selection features are turned ON.
Overlapping vertices (vertices at the same location) will be displayed separated by commas.
Once the tip vertex is selected, click the 'Proceed to Next' button at the bottom of the screen.
Step.5 Overview

From the materials you want to add blur settings to, select the vertices on the blade side where you want to display the blur.
Blur material will be generated on the vertices between the ridge vertex selected in Step.3, the tip vertex selected in Step.4, and the blade vertices selected here.
The order of selection is arbitrary.
Once the selection of blade vertices is complete, click the 'Preview' button at the bottom of the screen.
Step.5 Preview Overview

id: Step5プレビューメッセージ
translation:
Click the 'Preview' button to display the model with the added blur on top of the original model.
(For camera operation, refer to Menu > Viewer > Instructions)

[Things to Check]
- Does the blur extend only on the ridge side? 
   The blur material is set to extend only on the ridge side to represent the momentum
   (The blur material extends in the opposite direction of the downward motion)
   Please confirm that the blur does not extend in a strange direction
   (To make the blur part easier to understand, a red morph has been added)
- Are there any missing vertices in the blur material? 
   The vertices on the ridge side are set to extend as blur, and the vertices on the blade side are made to follow the main body.
   If there are holes in the blur material, it means that there are not enough vertices selected in Step.5.

If you want to change the settings, click the 'Cancel Preview and Readjust' button, the second in Step.5.
(Although you can edit during the preview, new settings will not be reflected unless you click the 'Preview' button)
If there were no issues, click the 'Save' button.
